name: Roll Call
overview: Roll Call, Inc. operates as a news source for coverage of the people, politics, and process that shape the legislative landscape. The companyâ€™s publications provide readers with coverage of the various legislative and political maneuvers that happen on Capitol Hill. It also offers coverage on various policy areas, such as agenda, entitlements, judiciary, aging, environment, labor, agriculture, financial services, land use, appropriations, foreign policy, leadership, budget, government contracting, pensions, commerce, government operations, science and technology, consumer protection, health, small business, ConventionNow, homeland security, space, defense, housing, taxes, economy, humanities, telecommunications, education, immigration, trade, elections, Indian affairs, transition, emergency management, infrastructure, transportation, energy, intelligence, and veterans affairs. In addition, the company offers CongressNow, a legislative wire service; Briefing Room, a centralized policy and document intelligence service; and GalleryWatch, a bill and document-tracking service. Further, itâ€™s online and offline products include congressional directory; CapwizXC, an online grassroots advocacy suite; and Knowlegis, a collection of online tools providing legislative data. The company was founded in 1955 and is based in Washington, District of Columbia. Roll Call, Inc. operates as a subsidiary of The Economist Group, Inc.
